Therefore, the exemption applies to supplies of instruction in courses for which credit toward a diploma may be obtained where those courses are offered by a school authority, either at night as part of a continuing education program or during the day, even if some students are not taking the courses as part of a diploma program.

                  ACT:
                  Section 7 of Part III of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
                   
                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Memorandum 20.1, School Authorities - Elementary and Secondary Schools

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school

                  Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school?

                  Vocational school means an organization that is established and operated primarily to provide students with correspondence courses, or instruction in courses, that develop or enhance students’ occupational skills.

                  • Finished - Course materials
                  • Finished - Vocational courses
                  • Finished - Second language instruction in English or French
                  • Finished - Courses in respect of professional or trade accreditations or designations
                  • Finished - Course being supplied to a non-registrant non-resident that is not an individual
                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Course materials

                  Are the course materials part of a single supply with a GST/HST exempt service of instruction?

                  Students often purchase course materials that relate to a service of instruction, such as textbooks, dictionaries, notes and compact discs, from the person supplying the service of instruction. The course materials may either be part of a single supply of a service of instruction that consists of several elements or be supplied separately from the supply of a service of instruction.

                  • Yes
                  • No
                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Course materials
                  4. Are the course materials part of a single supply with a GST/HST exempt service of instruction? – Yes

                  RESULT:

                  The course materials included in the single supply of GST/HST exempt instruction would also be exempt.
                   
                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Policy Statement P-077R2, Single and Multiple Supplies

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Course materials
                  4. Are the course materials part of a single supply with a GST/HST exempt service of instruction? – No

                  RESULT:

                  The separate supply of the course materials would not be GST/HST exempt under Part III of Schedule V and would be taxable unless another exempting provision of the Excise Tax Act applies to the supply.
                   
                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Policy Statement P-077R2, Single and Multiple Supplies

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Vocational courses

                  RESULT:

                  These courses are GST/HST exempt if the service is of instructing individuals in courses leading to certificates, diplomas, licences or similar documents, or classes or ratings in respect of licences, that attest to the competence of individuals to practise or perform a trade or vocation. A service of administering an examination in respect of such a course is also exempt.
                   
                  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
                  The exempting legislation also provides the supplier of such courses the option of electing to make the course fees taxable.
                   
                  ACT:
                  Section 8 of Part III of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
                   
                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Memorandum 20.4, Vocational Schools and Courses

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Second language instruction in English or French

                  RESULT:

                  GST/HST exempt (instructing individuals in, or administering examinations in respect of, language courses that form part of a program of second‑language instruction in either English or French)

                  ACT:
                  Section 11 of Part III of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Memorandum 20.7, Second Language Instruction

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Courses in respect of professional or trade accreditations or designations

                  RESULT:

                  These courses are GST/HST exempt if the service is of instructing individuals in courses leading to, or for the purpose of maintaining or upgrading, a professional or trade accreditation or designation recognized by a regulatory body. The supply of a certificate, or a service of administering an examination, in respect of such a course is also exempt.
                   
                  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
                  The exempting legislation also provides the supplier of such courses the option of electing to make the course fees taxable.
                   
                  ACT:
                  Section 6 of Part III of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
                   
                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Memorandum 20.4, Vocational Schools and Courses

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – Finished - Vocational school
                  3. Which option best describes the supply being made by the vocational school? – Finished - Course being supplied to a non-registrant non-resident that is not an individual

                  RESULT:

                  Zero-rated if the service is of instructing non-resident individuals in courses leading to certificates, diplomas, licences or similar documents, or classes or ratings in respect of licences, that attest to the competence of individuals to practise or perform a trade or vocation. A service of administering an examination in respect of such a situation is also exempt.
                   
                  ACT:
                  Section 18 of Part V of Schedule VI to the Excise Tax Act
                   
                  REFERENCE:
                  GST/HST Memorandum 20.4, Vocational Schools and Courses

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution

                  Which option best describes the supply?

                  • Finished - Catering
                  • Finished - Exported supply
                  • Finished - Property or service supplied by a municipality
                  • Finished - Property that was used in a commercial activity
                  • Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the public institution
                  • Finished - Other supplies that qualify for zero-rating under Schedule VI
                  • Finished - Supplies of performing artists to a person who makes taxable supplies admissions for the performance
                  • In progress - Lease of personal property in conjunction with an exempt lease of real property by the institution
                  • Finished - Tangible personal property acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a sale of the property
                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Catering

                  RESULT:

                  Supply is taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% when the property or service is made by the institution under a contract for catering for an event or occasion sponsored or arranged by another person who contracts with the institution for catering

                  ACT:
                  • Paragraph 1(e) of Part IV of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                  • Paragraph 1(g) of Part IV of Schedule V to the ETA

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Exported supply

                  RESULT:

                  Zero-rated
                   
                  ACT:
                  • Schedule VI to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                  • Zero-rated exported supplies are excluded from GST/HST exemption under paragraph 2(a) of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA
                  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
                  See GST/HST Policy Statement P-132, 100% Rebate for Exports by a Charity or a Public Institution

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Property or service supplied by a municipality

                  RESULT:

                  Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(n) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Property that was used in a commercial activity

                  Is the property being supplied capital property?

                  Capital property of a taxpayer, for GST/HST purposes, means​​​​

                  • any depreciable property of the taxpayer, and
                  • any property (other than depreciable property), any gain or loss from the disposition of which would, if the property were disposed of, be a capital gain or a capital loss, as the case may be, of the taxpayer;
                  other than property described in Class 12, 14, 14.1 or 44 of Schedule II to the Income Tax Regulations. It also includes, in respect of a person, property that would meet that definition if the person were a taxpayer under the Income Tax Act.

                  • Yes
                  • No
                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Property that was used in a commercial activity
                  4. Is the property being supplied capital property? – Yes

                  Was the property used primarily (more than 50%) in commercial activities of the institution?

                  The time period of that commercial activity refers to the time immediately before tax would become payable if it were a taxable supply.

                  • Yes
                  • No
                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Property that was used in a commercial activity
                  4. Is the property being supplied capital property? – Yes
                  5. Was the property used primarily (more than 50%) in commercial activities of the institution? – Yes

                  RESULT:

                  Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(d) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Property that was used in a commercial activity
                  4. Is the property being supplied capital property? – Yes
                  5. Was the property used primarily (more than 50%) in commercial activities of the institution? – No

                  RESULT:

                  GST/HST exempt

                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(d) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Property that was used in a commercial activity
                  4. Is the property being supplied capital property? – No

                  RESULT:

                  Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% if the property is not property that was acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a supply of the property. 

                  The time period of that commercial activity refers to the time immediately before tax would become payable if it were a taxable supply.
                   
                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(c) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the public institution

                  What was the Excise Tax Act authority for the supply to be deemed to be made by the public institution?

                  • Section 187
                  • Section 136.1
                  • Any other section under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act
                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the public institution
                  4. What was the Excise Tax Act authority for the supply to be deemed to be made by the public institution? – Section 187

                  RESULT:

                  GST/HST exempt
                   
                  ACT:
                  Section 5.2 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the public institution
                  4. What was the Excise Tax Act authority for the supply to be deemed to be made by the public institution? – Section 136.1

                  RESULT:

                  GST/HST exempt if deemed only under section 136.1
                   
                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(b) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the public institution
                  4. What was the Excise Tax Act authority for the supply to be deemed to be made by the public institution? – Any other section under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act

                  RESULT:

                  Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%
                   
                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(b) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Other supplies that qualify for zero-rating under Schedule VI

                  RESULT:

                  Zero-rated
                   
                  ACT:
                  • Schedule VI to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                  • Paragraph 2(a) of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA excludes from the general exemption any supplies that qualify for zero-rating under Schedule VI
                  EXAMPLE:
                  Supplies of medical and assistive devices that are zero-rated under Part II of Schedule VI do not become GST/HST exempt when supplied by a public institution.

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Supplies of performing artists to a person who makes taxable supplies admissions for the performance

                  Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                  ACT:
                  Paragraph 2(i) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                  1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                  2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                  3. Which option best describes the supply? – In progress - Lease of personal property in conjunction with an exempt lease of real property by the institution

                  Decision

                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                    3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Tangible personal property acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a sale of the property

                    Was the property donated to the institution or used by another person before it was acquired by the institution?

                    • Yes
                    • No
                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                    3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Tangible personal property acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a sale of the property
                    4. Was the property donated to the institution or used by another person before it was acquired by the institution? – Yes

                    RESULT:

                    GST/HST exempt

                    ACT:
                    Paragraph 2(e) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                    3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Tangible personal property acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a sale of the property
                    4. Was the property donated to the institution or used by another person before it was acquired by the institution? – No

                    Was the property supplied by the institution under a contract for catering?

                    • Yes
                    • No
                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                    3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Tangible personal property acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a sale of the property
                    4. Was the property donated to the institution or used by another person before it was acquired by the institution? – No
                    5. Was the property supplied by the institution under a contract for catering? – Yes

                    RESULT:

                    Supply is taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% when the property or service is made by the institution under a contract for catering for an event or occasion sponsored or arranged by another person who contracts with the institution for catering

                    ACT:
                    • Paragraph 1(e) of Part IV of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                    • Paragraph 1(g) of Part IV of Schedule V to the ETA

                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – In progress - Public institution
                    3. Which option best describes the supply? – Finished - Tangible personal property acquired, manufactured or produced by the institution for the purpose of making a sale of the property
                    4. Was the property donated to the institution or used by another person before it was acquired by the institution? – No
                    5. Was the property supplied by the institution under a contract for catering? – No

                    RESULT:

                    Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                    ACT:
                    Paragraph 1(e) of Part IV of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – References for building Public institution topic

                    References

                    When building mapping, create questions for public institution supplies based on sections 2, 3, 3.1, 5.1, 5.2 and 28 of Part VI of Schedule V.

                    Also, refer to Commentary 4,070 — Supplies by charities, public sector bodies, and public institutions (which is copied here but additional spacing, bullets and bold text were added for my emphasis):

                    [Schedule V, Parts V.1 and VI] — A number of supplies made by charities, public sector bodies, and public institutions are exempt.
                    For purposes of these exemptions,

                    1. Public sector bodies:
                      • exclude charities and
                      • include governments as well as non-profit organizations, municipalities, school authorities, hospital authorities, and public colleges and universities.
                    2. Public institutions include organizations that are school authorities, public colleges, and universities that are also charities.

                    To the extent the activities of a public sector body or public institution are considered commercial, those supplies are generally taxable.

                    For a full discussion of the application of GST/HST to supplies by these institutions, as well as rebate provisions, see Chapter 12, Non-profit and charity sector and ¶9,055 to ¶9,097, respectively.

                    • a
                    • b
                    1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                    2. Who is making the supply? – References for building Public institution topic
                    3. References – a

                    Decision

                      1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress - Municipality, university, school or hospital
                      2. Who is making the supply? – References for building Public institution topic
                      3. References – b

                      Decision

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization

                        Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity?

                        Public service body includes a non-profit organization.
                        Public sector body includes a public service body.

                        The definition of non-profit organization does not include organizations such as a public institution.

                        • Finished - Admission
                        • Finished - Library cards
                        • Finished - Unbottled water
                        • Finished - Supply of poppy or wreath
                        • Finished - Membership in a registered party
                        • Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        • Finished - Property or services sold for direct cost
                        • Finished - Supply for the benefit of organized labour
                        • Finished - Membership to maintain a professional status
                        • Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        • Finished - All or substantially all supplies made for no consideration
                        • In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                        • Finished - Right to play or participate in a game of chance (other than an admission)
                        • Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the institution under section 187 of the Excise Tax Act
                        • Finished - Food, beverages or short-term accommodation supplied to relieve poverty, suffering or distress of individuals
                        • Finished - Membership (or other right) entitling person to supervision or instruction in recreational or athletic activity
                        • Finished - Food or beverages supplied under a program to seniors, underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability
                        • Finished - Board and lodging or recreational services, at a recreational camp supplied to underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission

                        Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        Section 9 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No

                        Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – Yes

                        Are the functions (administrative, operating the game and taking the bets) performed exclusively by volunteers?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – Yes
                        5. Are the functions (administrative, operating the game and taking the bets) performed exclusively by volunteers? – Yes

                        Is the place of amusement either a bingo or a casino?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – Yes
                        5. Are the functions (administrative, operating the game and taking the bets) performed exclusively by volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Is the place of amusement either a bingo or a casino? – Yes

                        Is the game conducted in premises or at a place, including any temporary structure, that is used primarily for the purposes of conducting gambling activities?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – Yes
                        5. Are the functions (administrative, operating the game and taking the bets) performed exclusively by volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Is the place of amusement either a bingo or a casino? – Yes
                        7. Is the game conducted in premises or at a place, including any temporary structure, that is used primarily for the purposes of conducting gambling activities? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% unless the situation is one where a different GST/HST exemption would apply 
                         
                        ACT:
                        Section 5 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – Yes
                        5. Are the functions (administrative, operating the game and taking the bets) performed exclusively by volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Is the place of amusement either a bingo or a casino? – Yes
                        7. Is the game conducted in premises or at a place, including any temporary structure, that is used primarily for the purposes of conducting gambling activities? – No

                        Section 5 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        Is the supply the sale of tickets to spectators of a performance, athletic event or any competitive event?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission

                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – No
                        5. Is the supply the sale of tickets to spectators of a performance, athletic event or any competitive event? – Yes

                        Is it the case that 90% or more of the performers, athletes or competitors are not remunerated, directly or indirectly, for their participation?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – No
                        5. Is the supply the sale of tickets to spectators of a performance, athletic event or any competitive event? – Yes
                        6. Is it the case that 90% or more of the performers, athletes or competitors are not remunerated, directly or indirectly, for their participation? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        Section 11 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Admission
                        3. Is the admission for a place of amusement and the admission cost not more than $1? – No
                        4. Is the admission for a place of amusement whose principal activity is the placing of bets or the playing of games of chance? – No
                        5. Is the supply the sale of tickets to spectators of a performance, athletic event or any competitive event? – Yes
                        6. Is it the case that 90% or more of the performers, athletes or competitors are not remunerated, directly or indirectly, for their participation? – No

                        RESULT:

                        Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                        Section 11 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
