                        ACT:
                        Section 11 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Library cards

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        Section 19 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
                        Library fines do not need to be listed as GST/HST exempt since the fines are not consideration for a supply and therefore have no GST/HST consequences. 

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Unbottled water

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt, other than:
                        • a zero-rated supply. or
                        • a supply of water dispensed in single servings to consumers:
                        • through a vending machine
                        • at a permanent establishment of the supplier

                        ACT:
                        Section 23 of Part VI of Schedule V of the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of poppy or wreath

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt when the supply is made by either:
                        • the Minister of Veteran Affairs in the course of operating a sheltered employment workshop
                        • the Dominion Command, or any provincial command or branch of the Royal Canadian Legion

                        ACT:
                        Section 27 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Membership in a registered party

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        Section 18.1 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property

                        Is the property being sold excisable goods?

                        Excisable goods means:

                        • beer or malt liquor (within the meaning assigned by section 4 of the Excise Act), and
                        • spirits, wine, tobacco products, cannabis products and vaping products (within the meaning assigned by section 2 of the Excise Act, 2001)

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                        ACT:
                        • Section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                        • Subsection 123(1) of the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No

                        Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        No GST/HST exemption exists for the supply in section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA). If no other legislation exempts or zero-rates the supply, the sale would be taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%.

                        ACT:
                        Paragraph 4(a) of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No

                        Are all of the salespersons volunteers?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No
                        5. Are all of the salespersons volunteers? – Yes

                        Does the consideration for any item exceed $5?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No
                        5. Are all of the salespersons volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Does the consideration for any item exceed $5? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        No GST/HST exemption exists for the supply in section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA). If no other legislation exempts or zero-rates the supply, the sale would be taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%.

                        ACT:
                        Paragraph 4(c) of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No
                        5. Are all of the salespersons volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Does the consideration for any item exceed $5? – No

                        Is the property sold at an event at which supplies of property of the kind or class supplied are made by persons who carry on the business of selling such property?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No
                        5. Are all of the salespersons volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Does the consideration for any item exceed $5? – No
                        7. Is the property sold at an event at which supplies of property of the kind or class supplied are made by persons who carry on the business of selling such property? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        No GST/HST exemption exists for the supply in section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA). If no other legislation exempts or zero-rates the supply, the sale would be taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%.

                        ACT:
                        Section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No
                        5. Are all of the salespersons volunteers? – Yes
                        6. Does the consideration for any item exceed $5? – No
                        7. Is the property sold at an event at which supplies of property of the kind or class supplied are made by persons who carry on the business of selling such property? – No

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        Section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Sale of tangible personal property
                        3. Is the property being sold excisable goods? – No
                        4. Does the organization carry on the business of selling such property? – No
                        5. Are all of the salespersons volunteers? – No

                        RESULT:

                        No GST/HST exemption exists for the supply in section 4 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA). If no other legislation exempts or zero-rates the supply, the sale would be taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%.

                        ACT:
                        Paragraph 4(b) of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Property or services sold for direct cost

                        Is the supply capital property?

                        Capital property of a taxpayer, for GST/HST purposes, means​​​​

                        • any depreciable property of the taxpayer, and
                        • any property (other than depreciable property), any gain or loss from the disposition of which would, if the property were disposed of, be a capital gain or a capital loss, as the case may be, of the taxpayer;
                        other than property described in Class 12, 14, 14.1 or 44 of Schedule II to the Income Tax Regulations. It also includes, in respect of a person, property that would meet that definition if the person were a taxpayer under the Income Tax Act.

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Property or services sold for direct cost
                        3. Is the supply capital property? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        No GST/HST exemption exists for the supply in section 6 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA). If no other legislation exempts or zero-rates the supply, the sale would be taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%.

                        ACT:
                        Section 6 of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Property or services sold for direct cost
                        3. Is the supply capital property? – No

                        Is the supply a service purchased by the non-profit organization for the purpose of making a sale of the service?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Property or services sold for direct cost
                        3. Is the supply capital property? – No
                        4. Is the supply a service purchased by the non-profit organization for the purpose of making a sale of the service? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        No GST/HST exemption exists for the supply in section 6 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA). If no other legislation exempts or zero-rates the supply, the sale would be taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%.

                        ACT:
                        Section 6 of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Property or services sold for direct cost
                        3. Is the supply capital property? – No
                        4. Is the supply a service purchased by the non-profit organization for the purpose of making a sale of the service? – No

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt if the total charge for the supply is the usual charge by the organization for such supplies to such recipients and:
                        • if the organization does not charge the recipient any amount as GST/HST for the supply, the total charge for the supply does not, and could not reasonably be expected to, exceed the direct cost of the supply; and
                        • if the organization charges the recipient an amount as GST/HST the supply, the consideration for the supply does not, and could not reasonably be expected to, equal or exceed the direct cost of the supply determined without reference to either:
                        • GST/HST imposed under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, or
                        • QST that became payable under the first paragraph of section 16 of An Act respecting the Québec sales tax, R.S.Q., c. T-0.1, at a time when the organization was a registrant as defined in section 1 of that Act.

                        ACT:
                        Section 6 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply for the benefit of organized labour

                        Who is the supply made to?

                        • Another NPO established primarily for the benefit of organized labour
                        • Trade union (or association or body referred to in paragraphs 189(a) to (c) that is a member of or affiliated with the organization)
                        • None of the above
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply for the benefit of organized labour
                        3. Who is the supply made to? – Another NPO established primarily for the benefit of organized labour

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        Section 26 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply for the benefit of organized labour
                        3. Who is the supply made to? – Trade union (or association or body referred to in paragraphs 189(a) to (c) that is a member of or affiliated with the organization)

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt

                        ACT:
                        • Section 26 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                        • Paragraphs 189(a) to (c) of the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply for the benefit of organized labour
                        3. Who is the supply made to? – None of the above

                        RESULT:

                        Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                        ACT:
                        Section 26 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Membership to maintain a professional status

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt if the membership is required to maintain a professional status recognized by statute, except where the NPO supplier has made a valid election using Form GST24.

                        ACT:
                        Section 18 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body

                        Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        3. Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        Although the general exemption for memberships supplied by an NPO does not apply for these types of memberships, the supply may be GST/HST exempt for other reasons 

                        ACT:
                        Section 17 of Part VI of Schedule VI to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        3. Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party? – No

                        Does each member receive a benefit (by reason of the membership)?

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        3. Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party? – No
                        4. Does each member receive a benefit (by reason of the membership)? – Yes

                        Are the only benefits all included in the following list?

                        List of benefits to membership

                        • an indirect benefit that is intended to accrue to all members collectively
                        • the right to receive services supplied by the NPO that are in the nature of investigating, conciliating or settling complaints or disputes involving members
                        • the right to vote at or participate in meetings
                        • the right to receive or acquire property or services supplied to the member for consideration that is not part of the consideration for the membership and that is equal to the fair market value of the property or services at the time the supply is made
                        • the right to receive a discount on the value of the consideration for a supply to be made by the NPO where the total value of all such discounts to which a member is entitled by reason of the membership is insignificant in relation to the consideration for the membership
                        • the right to receive periodic newsletters, reports or publications:
                          • the value of which is insignificant in relation to the consideration for the membership, or
                          • that provide information on the activities of the NPO or its financial status, other than newsletters, reports or publications the value of which is significant in relation to the consideration for the membership and for which a fee is ordinarily charged by the body to non-members

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        3. Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party? – No
                        4. Does each member receive a benefit (by reason of the membership)? – Yes
                        5. Are the only benefits all included in the following list? – Yes

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt unless the NPO has made a valid election using Form GST23, Election by a Public Sector Body to Have its Exempt Memberships Treated as Taxable Supplies

                        ACT:
                        Section 17 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        3. Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party? – No
                        4. Does each member receive a benefit (by reason of the membership)? – Yes
                        5. Are the only benefits all included in the following list? – No

                        RESULT:

                        Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                        ACT:
                        Section 17 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply of a membership in a public sector body
                        3. Is the membership in a club the main purpose of which is to provide dining, recreational or sporting facilities or in a registered party? – No
                        4. Does each member receive a benefit (by reason of the membership)? – No

                        RESULT:

                        GST/HST exempt unless the NPO has made a valid election using Form GST23, Election by a Public Sector Body to Have its Exempt Memberships Treated as Taxable Supplies

                        ACT:
                        Section 17 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - All or substantially all supplies made for no consideration

                        RESULT:

                        Supplies are GST/HST exempt, other than supplies of:
                        • parking spaces by lease, licence or similar arrangement in the course of a business carried on by a organization (see the "Real property" subtopic for rules relating to the tax status of parking spaces)
                        • blood or blood derivatives (as those supplies are zero-rated under Schedule VI) 
                        ACT:
                        • Section 10 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                        • Schedule VI to the ETA

                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property

                        Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property?

                        • In progress - Parking space
                        • Finished - Short-term accommodation
                        • Finished - Sale of a residential complex
                        • Finished - Lease or licence (other than short term accommodation)
                        • Finished - Sale of real property to an individual or personal trust
                        • Finished - Supply deemed to be made under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act
                        • Finished - Supply of real property when a section 211 election is in effect
                        • Finished - Sale or lease of property used primarily in commercial activities of the NPO
                        • Finished - Real property the last supply of which to the NPO was deemed to have been made under subsection 183(1)
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                        3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – In progress - Parking space

                        Ask sequence of questions based on section 25.1 of Part VI of Schedule V, also factoring in that paragraph 25(h) removes from the general real property exemption for an NPO the supply of a parking space made by way of lease, licence or similar arrangement in the course of a business carried on by the NPO (while also considering that there are other areas of legislation that may provide exemption)

                        • Yes
                        • No
                        1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                        2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                        3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – In progress - Parking space
                        4. Ask sequence of questions based on section 25.1 of Part VI of Schedule V, also factoring in that paragraph 25(h) removes from the general real property exemption for an NPO the supply of a parking space made by way of lease, licence or similar arrangement in the course of a business carried on by the NPO (while also considering that there are other areas of legislation that may provide exemption) – Yes

                        Decision

                          1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                          2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                          3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – In progress - Parking space
                          4. Ask sequence of questions based on section 25.1 of Part VI of Schedule V, also factoring in that paragraph 25(h) removes from the general real property exemption for an NPO the supply of a parking space made by way of lease, licence or similar arrangement in the course of a business carried on by the NPO (while also considering that there are other areas of legislation that may provide exemption) – No

                          Decision

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Short-term accommodation

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                            ACT:
                            • Paragraph 25(e) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                            • Subsection 123(1) of the ETA

                            ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
                            Short-term accommodation means a period of occupancy or a right of occupancy by an individual in a residential complex or a residential unit that is supplied by way of lease, licence or similar arrangement for a period of less than one month where such occupation is for use as a place of residence or lodging. The period of occupancy is calculated as a period where the same individual is given continuous occupancy, notwithstanding that the rental may be on a daily or weekly basis.

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale of a residential complex

                            RESULT:

                            Although removed from the general GST/HST exemption for real property found in section 25 of Part VI of Schedule V, the sale may be GST/HST exempt for other reasons. For more information for this type of supply, see the "Real property" subtopic under the category "Most businesses".

                            ACT:
                            • Paragraph 25(a) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                            • Part I of Schedule V to the ETA

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Lease or licence (other than short term accommodation)

                            Which best describes the supply of real property?

                            Short-term accommodation means a period of occupancy or a right of occupancy by an individual in a residential complex or a residential unit that is supplied by way of lease, licence or similar arrangement for a period of less than one month where such occupation is for use as a place of residence or lodging. The period of occupancy is calculated as a period where the same individual is given continuous occupancy, notwithstanding that the rental may be on a daily or weekly basis.

                            • Licence
                            • Lease for continuous possession of one month or more
                            • Lease for continuous possession of less than one month
                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Lease or licence (other than short term accommodation)
                            4. Which best describes the supply of real property? – Licence

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                            ACT:
                            • Paragraph 25(f) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                            • Subsection 123(1) of the ETA

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Lease or licence (other than short term accommodation)
                            4. Which best describes the supply of real property? – Lease for continuous possession of one month or more

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt unless the specific type of supply is removed for a different reason from the general exemption for supplies of real property by an NPO 

                            ACT:
                            Paragraph 25(f) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Lease or licence (other than short term accommodation)
                            4. Which best describes the supply of real property? – Lease for continuous possession of less than one month

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% if the supply is made in the course of a business carried on by the NPO

                            ACT:
                            • Paragraph 25(f) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act (ETA)
                            • Subsection 123(1) of the ETA

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale of real property to an individual or personal trust

                            Is there a structure on the property that was used by the NPO as an office or in the course of either commercial activities or of making exempt supplies?

                            • Yes
                            • No
                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale of real property to an individual or personal trust
                            4. Is there a structure on the property that was used by the NPO as an office or in the course of either commercial activities or of making exempt supplies? – Yes

                            Was the property used primarily in commercial activities of the NPO immediately before tax would be payable if it were a taxable sale?

                            • Yes
                            • No
                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale of real property to an individual or personal trust
                            4. Is there a structure on the property that was used by the NPO as an office or in the course of either commercial activities or of making exempt supplies? – Yes
                            5. Was the property used primarily in commercial activities of the NPO immediately before tax would be payable if it were a taxable sale? – Yes

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                            ACT:
                            Paragraphs 25(c) and 25(d) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale of real property to an individual or personal trust
                            4. Is there a structure on the property that was used by the NPO as an office or in the course of either commercial activities or of making exempt supplies? – Yes
                            5. Was the property used primarily in commercial activities of the NPO immediately before tax would be payable if it were a taxable sale? – No

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt unless the specific type of supply is removed for a different reason from the general exemption for supplies of real property by an NPO 

                            ACT:
                            Paragraphs 25(c) and 25(d) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale of real property to an individual or personal trust
                            4. Is there a structure on the property that was used by the NPO as an office or in the course of either commercial activities or of making exempt supplies? – No

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                            ACT:
                            Paragraph 25(c) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act

                            Was the supply deemed only under section 136.1 to have been made?

                            • Yes
                            • No
                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act
                            4. Was the supply deemed only under section 136.1 to have been made? – Yes

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt
                             
                            ACT:
                            Paragraph 25(b) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act
                            4. Was the supply deemed only under section 136.1 to have been made? – No

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST taxable
                             
                            ACT:
                            Paragraph 25(b) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Supply of real property when a section 211 election is in effect

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST taxable if the election is in effect at the time tax would become payable under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act (ETA) in respect of the supply if it were a taxable supply

                            ACT:
                            • Paragraph 25(g) of Part VI of Schedule V to the ETA
                            • Section 211 of the ETA

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Sale or lease of property used primarily in commercial activities of the NPO

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% if the property was used primarily in commercial activities of the NPO immediately before tax would be payable if it were a taxable sale

                            ACT:
                            Paragraph 25(d) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Real property
                            3. Which best describes the non-profit organization's supply of real property? – Finished - Real property the last supply of which to the NPO was deemed to have been made under subsection 183(1)

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                            ACT:
                            Paragraph 25(i) of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Right to play or participate in a game of chance (other than an admission)

                            Is the supply a prescribed game of chance?

                            A prescribed game of chance is one that is conducted by one of the following persons:

                            • the Atlantic Lottery Corporation
                            • the British Columbia Lottery Corporation
                            • the Manitoba Liquor and Lotteries Corporation
                            • the Ontario Lottery and Gaming Corporation
                            • la Société des loteries et courses du Québec
                            • the Western Canada Lottery Corporation
                            • the Interprovincial Lottery Corporation
                            • the Alberta Gaming and Liquor Commission
                            • the Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority
                            • the Saskatchewan Gaming Corporation
                            • the New Brunswick Lotteries and Gaming Corporation
                            • the Nova Scotia Provincial Lotteries and Casino Corporation

                            • Yes
                            • No
                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Right to play or participate in a game of chance (other than an admission)
                            3. Is the supply a prescribed game of chance? – Yes

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15%

                            ACT:
                            • Section 5.1 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
                            • Sections 3 and 4 of the Games of Chance (GST/HST) Regulations

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Right to play or participate in a game of chance (other than an admission)
                            3. Is the supply a prescribed game of chance? – No

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt

                            ACT:
                            • Section 5.1 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
                            • Sections 3 and 4 of the Games of Chance (GST/HST) Regulations

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Supply deemed to be made by the institution under section 187 of the Excise Tax Act

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt
                             
                            ACT:
                            Section 5.2 of Part V.1 of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Food, beverages or short-term accommodation supplied to relieve poverty, suffering or distress of individuals

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt if the supply is not for the purpose of fund-raising

                            ACT:
                            Section 14 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Membership (or other right) entitling person to supervision or instruction in recreational or athletic activity

                            Who is the membership intended to be provided primarily to?

                            • Children 14 years old or younger
                            • Underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability
                            • None of the above
                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Membership (or other right) entitling person to supervision or instruction in recreational or athletic activity
                            3. Who is the membership intended to be provided primarily to? – Children 14 years old or younger

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt if the supply is of a membership in, or services supplied as part of, a program established and operated by the NPO that consists of a series of supervised instructional classes or activities involving athletics, outdoor recreation, music, dance, arts, crafts or other hobbies or recreational pursuits where it may reasonably be expected that the program will be provided primarily to children 14 years of age or under, except where the program involves overnight supervision throughout a substantial portion of the program.
                             
                            ACT:
                            Section 12 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Membership (or other right) entitling person to supervision or instruction in recreational or athletic activity
                            3. Who is the membership intended to be provided primarily to? – Underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt if the supply is of a membership in, or services supplied as part of, a program established and operated by the NPO that consists of a series of supervised instructional classes or activities involving athletics, outdoor recreation, music, dance, arts, crafts or other hobbies or recreational pursuits where the program is provided primarily for underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability.
                              
                            ACT:
                            Section 12 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Membership (or other right) entitling person to supervision or instruction in recreational or athletic activity
                            3. Who is the membership intended to be provided primarily to? – None of the above

                            RESULT:

                            Taxable at 5%, 13% or 15% unless the specific type of supply is exempted for a different reason
                              
                            ACT:
                            Section 12 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Food or beverages supplied under a program to seniors, underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt when under a program established and operated for the purpose of providing prepared food to such individuals in their places of residence. Supplies of food or beverages made to the non-profit organization for the purpose of the program are also GST/HST exempt.

                            ACT:
                            Section 15 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act

                            1. Which best describes the business activity? – In progress (finished except for parking space scenarios) - Non-profit organization
                            2. Which best describes the non-profit organization's activity? – Finished - Board and lodging or recreational services, at a recreational camp supplied to underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability

                            RESULT:

                            GST/HST exempt when supplied under a program established and operated for the purpose of providing the board and lodging or services primarily to underprivileged individuals or individuals with a disability

                            ACT:
                            Section 13 of Part VI of Schedule V to the Excise Tax Act
